Interface Crawler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WebCrawler

    public interface Crawler
    Created by Basil on 29/03/2015. The Crawler interface contains methods for constructing a database of URL links given a base URL.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void crawl(java.net.URL webUrl, java.sql.Connection db, java.lang.String table, int depth, int max)
      crawl() This method takes a base URL, a connection to a database and the table to use, and the limits on how long to crawl for; depth, max.
      boolean search(java.net.URL webUrl)
      search() The search method scans the given URL for certain criteria and returns true if passed.

    • Method Detail

      • crawl

        void crawl(java.net.URL webUrl,
         java.sql.Connection db,
         java.lang.String table,
         int depth,
         int max)
        crawl() This method takes a base URL, a connection to a database and the table to use, and the limits on how long to crawl for; depth, max. The method opens a HTTP connection to the base URL and scans the webpage for other URL links. These are then stored in a temporary database until they are processed by the search function also present in this class. If the search terms are met, the URL is moved to the main results table. Each webpage parsed is stored in the database with a priority indicator that relates to the depth of the URL from the base. The base URL will have priority 0, any link found in the base URL will have priority 1, any link found in the URLs with priority 1 will have priority 2, and so on. The crawl method will iteratively cycle through all links in the database until either of the limiting criteria are met. The depth is the maximum numbers of levels from the base URL the crawl should go. Max is the maximum number of links that should be processed.
        Parameters:
        webUrl - a base URL from which to start the crawl
        db - a connection to a database to store the results
        table - the database table to store results in
        depth - the maximum depth from the base URL the crawl should go
        max - the maximum number of links that should be processed

      • search

        boolean search(java.net.URL webUrl)
        search() The search method scans the given URL for certain criteria and returns true if passed. By default, the method returns true on all links unless overridden in the implementation.
        Parameters:
        webUrl - a URL to scan
        Returns:
        true if criteria met
